title: System shutdown without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When shutting down Windows while a WSWB session with opened, dirty .txt file is open, a dialog box should appear asking users if they want to save their changes. The dialog box should have options for Yes, No, and Cancel. Selecting Cancel should halt the shutdown process.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command.
5. Verify that a dialog box appears asking if you want to save your file, with options for Yes, No, and Cancel.
